intro: Rinorea dewevrei, commonly known as the dwarf white-flowered rinorea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually ovate or elliptical, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface.
